description.narrative: 2.2. By 2021, government programmes are supported to scale up high impact innovative interventions to reduce HIV transmision and vulnerability among adolescents (10-19 years) (Second Decade), which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Hiv Prevention, Hiv Prevention (Covid), Hiv â€“ General, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2021, children, adolescents, and pregnant women use quality, accessible, and proven HIV prevention and treatment interventions.

participating-org.narrative: KAPIRI MPOSHI DISTRICT HEALTH MANAGEMENT TEAM

sector.narrative: HIV Prevention programs for adolescents including Key population such as condom programming, VMMC and PreP
HIV and sexuality education for adolescents
HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence
Innovation, multi-media content production and dissemination
Support Policy and guidance developments and address barriers to accessing HIV services by adolescents including gender mainstreaming
System strengthening for adolescent participation and civic engagement (including in humanitarian settings)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.2. By 2021, government programmes are supported to scale up high impact innovative interventions to reduce HIV transmision and vulnerability among adolescents (10-19 years) (Second Decade)

description.narrative: The number of UNICEF supported health facilities with Adolescent Friendly Spaces (AFS) providing services that are responsive to the needs of adolescents increased from 62 at baseline of the current country programme (2016) to 210 by June 2020. 38 target districts are currently implementing the adolescent health services platform, an increase from 25 at CPD baseline. Up to 183,254 adolescents aged 10-19 years have received an HIV test with marked gender differentials showing greater uptake among females. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Existence of National HIV and Prevention, PMTCT, Treatment and Care Strategy

title.narrative: The national MIS produces age-disagregated data on HIV for all districts on a quaterly basis
